alert.note: Alert for Adams; Arapahoe (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 7:07PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Adams and Arapahoe. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Badger Creek, West Bijou Creek, First Creek, Muddy Creek, Sherman Ranch Slough, Middle Bijou Creek, Poision Springs Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Rattlesnake Creek and East Bijou Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Byers.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
